articles.headline: After Settlement, Relief at a Diminished BP
articles.snippet: In preparation for a settlement over the 2010 gulf disaster, BP has sharply pruned its global operations to save itself, and now it can plan for its future.
articles.abstract: In preparation for a settlement over the 2010 gulf disaster, BP has sharply pruned its global operations to save itself, and now it can plan for its future.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — BP’s future no longer has a giant cloud ahead. But it will take years, if not decades, for the company to approach its size of five years ago, before the explosion of the Deepwater Horizon rig.
articles.byline: By Stanley Reed and Clifford Krauss

articles.headline: 2 Nuns, a Developer and Katy Perry Walk Into a Real Estate Deal
articles.snippet: The Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Los Angeles favors a deal to sell an eight-acre property to Ms. Perry — over the objections of nuns who have another plan in mind.
articles.abstract: The Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Los Angeles favors a deal to sell an eight-acre property to Ms. Perry — over the objections of nuns who have another plan in mind.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — God moves in mysterious ways — particularly when it comes to Los Angeles real estate.

articles.headline: Employers Have Greater Leeway on Unpaid Internships, Court Rules
articles.snippet: A ruling by federal appeals judges involving the studio Fox Searchlight Pictures could have broad ramifications for the way employers rely on unpaid work.
articles.abstract: A ruling by federal appeals judges involving the studio Fox Searchlight Pictures could have broad ramifications for the way employers rely on unpaid work.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Employers  have considerable leeway to use unpaid interns legally when the work serves an educational purpose, a federal appeals court ruled on Thursday, setting aside a lower court decision that the movie studio Fox Searchlight Pictures had improperly classified former workers as unpaid interns rather than employees.

articles.headline: Miss USA Pageant Finds a Televised Venue
articles.snippet: Reelz, a cable network, has stepped up to carry the Miss USA Pageant on July 12. Univision and NBC had backed out after Donald Trump’s comments on immigrants.
articles.abstract: Reelz, a cable network, has stepped up to carry the Miss USA Pageant on July 12. Univision and NBC had backed out after Donald Trump’s comments on immigrants.
articles.lead_paragraph: BATON ROUGE, La. — The symbolism wasn’t lost on the organizers and contestants of the 2015 Miss USA pageant Wednesday evening as thunderstorms drenched the public sports park where their first official media event was scheduled to take place.
articles.byline: By Jeremy Alford and John Koblin

articles.headline: Aetna Said to Be Near Deal to Buy Humana for $34 Billion
articles.snippet: A push for mergers among large insurers has gained momentum since the Supreme Court upheld a key part of the Obama administration’s health care law.
articles.abstract: A push for mergers among large insurers has gained momentum since the Supreme Court upheld a key part of the Obama administration’s health care law.
articles.lead_paragraph: Aetna is near an agreement to buy its smaller rival Humana for about $34 billion, people briefed on the matter said on Thursday, in what could be the first in a series of mergers among the country’s big health insurers.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: Air Passengers Applaud a Justice Dept. Collusion Case
articles.snippet: Peeved passengers are cheering on government investigators looking into possible collusion among the major domestic airlines.
articles.abstract: Peeved passengers are cheering on government investigators looking into possible collusion among the major domestic airlines.
articles.lead_paragraph: As the manager of her husband’s rock band, Jill Meniketti has booked many flights over the past 12 years.

articles.headline: Hopeful Start to Greek Debt Negotiations Quickly Soured
articles.snippet: Why Alexis Tsipras took the extreme step of a referendum remains puzzling. But a look at the events reveals missed chances between Greece and its creditors that led him to think a deal was impossible.
articles.abstract: Why Alexis Tsipras took the extreme step of a referendum remains puzzling. But a look at the events reveals missed chances between Greece and its creditors that led him to think a deal was impossible.
articles.lead_paragraph: ATHENS — Last Friday morning, the Greek prime minister, Alexis Tsipras, gathered his closest advisers in a Brussels hotel room for a meeting that was meant to be secret. All the participants had to leave their phones outside the door to prevent leaks.

articles.headline: Bernie Sanders’s Revolutionary Roots Were Nurtured in ’60s Vermont
articles.snippet: Long before Mr. Sanders was a presidential candidate, he went to Burlington, where he supported himself with odd jobs and planned to remake the world.
articles.abstract: Long before Mr. Sanders was a presidential candidate, he went to Burlington, where he supported himself with odd jobs and planned to remake the world.
articles.lead_paragraph: BURLINGTON, Vt. — When he came to Vermont in the late 1960s to help plan the upending of the old social order, the future presidential candidate Bernie Sanders brought with him the belief that the United States was starkly divided into two groups: the establishment and the revolutionaries. He was a revolutionary.

articles.headline: Effective Concussion Treatment Remains Frustratingly Elusive, Despite a Booming Industry
articles.snippet: Start-ups and doctors are in zealous pursuit of new and sometimes controversial ways to prevent, detect and treat concussions.
articles.abstract: Start-ups and doctors are in zealous pursuit of new and sometimes controversial ways to prevent, detect and treat concussions.
articles.lead_paragraph: In a small brick building across the street from a Taco Bell in Marrero, La., patients enter a clear plastic capsule and breathe pure oxygen.
articles.byline: By Barry Meier and Danielle Ivory
